availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George J. Passmore (Mercer County, KY, blacksmith)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Son of Elizabeth Passmore. Married to Malinda B. Burton Passmore. Father of Bettie Passmore, George Passmore, Julia Passmore, and Henry Passmore. Blacksmith in Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1850. Blacksmith in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 1, p. 273B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 1, p. 869.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 723.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 26056.
"George J. Passmore II (1826-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial 107002294, accessed November 11, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/107002294.
